title: Senior Frontend Engineer (based in Vietnam)
description:
The Zuhlke Opportunity.
Thrive in an environment where you can express your passion and enthusiasm for software development and be inspired by your colleagues’ enthusiasm. As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will cooperate with interdisciplinary teams in projects and experience how technology and team spirit unite to create innovative solutions.

As part of the pioneer team, you will have the unique opportunity to be onboarded by our high performing Singapore-based colleagues for three months. On top of experiencing the sights and sounds of another vibrant city, you will also receive mentorship within teams who have diverse technical knowledge. And of course, this is only to kickstart your long-term success upon your return home.

Our reputation is fundamental to our business, so our culture emphasizes quality, reliability, and respect. We value learning new technologies and skills thus, we invest in a generous local training budget to attend conferences, participate in certified... courses, and our annual technical camp is a lot of fun.

Your Talent. You have a degree in computer science or an equivalent related field (bachelor's/master's). You have professional experience in ReactJS for at least 3-5 years. You have proven expertise in the JavaScript ecosystem (Es, Typescript) and frameworks like ReactJS and its ecosystem (Redux, ES6, CodePush) where you apply your in-depth knowledge to build highly responsive user interfaces or progressive web applications which integrate with REST APIs AJAX and JSON. You have strong knowledge in development (IDEA, Storybook), state management (Redux), and application architectures (Flux). You have multiple years of experience with state-of-the-art web architectures and enjoy developing modern web applications where you design, develop, and maintain code that meets requirements, is high quality, and performs efficiently and effectively to provide a great customer experience. You value high quality code standards, and your implementation includes best practices with considerations of performance, security, scalability, and maintainability and you want to satisfy your thirst for knowledge of the latest technologies every day. You have good experience with Development and Operations (DevOps), using continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) to ship incremental improvements and have used CI/CD tools such as git, GitHub, Jira, Jenkins, or equivalents. You have a thorough knowledge of building and deploying Full Stack applications, including experience in automated testing frameworks like Mocha, Jest and Enzyme or similar. You have professional experience working in an agile development environment where you lead the collaboration within internal application stakeholders, Infrastructure team and vendors/third-party services to deliver the full lifecycle, including requirements, architecture, design, development, testing, deployment and support. Ideally, you are a certified Scrum developer or master. You have strong communication skills, like making decisions, believe in continual improvement and investment in your knowledge and work independently. As a plus, you have experience in AWS cloud engineering & implementation As a plus, you have good understanding of digital banking products, processes, and retail banking systems.
Life at Zuhlke.
At Zuhlke Asia you get the best of both worlds. You can leverage on the benefits of working in a stable, large, highly reputable company with a long history of success while enjoying the freedom and autonomy of working in a fast-growing start-up environment. Zuhlke offers you networked innovation power and the security of a long-running, international success story. We support your personal development with specialised workshops and active knowledge sharing among experts

The Role

This position reports to the Manager of the System Integration and Network Department. The incumbent will be part of the IT Quick Solution team (IT Innovation Team) to assist Banking IT operation in SMBC. The IT Quick Solution team is responsible for innovation / disruptive technology and improving IT... capabilities in the bank.

• Part of a SWAT team to design and develop application for SMBC

Requirements

title: Cloud Native Security Architect (DevSecOps)
description:
About Us

Dell Technologies unites seven technology leaders – Dell, Dell EMC, Pivotal, RSA, Secureworks, Virtustream and VMware – in one company with the power to drive digital transformation and generate real results every day for the customers and people who partner with us.

Pivotal Software, Inc. combines platform, tools, and methodology to help the world's largest companies transform the way they build software and run their most strategic applications. Our technology is used by Global 2000 companies and developers to give software development and IT operations a strategic advantage. Founded in 2013, Pivotal unleashes software-developer productivity and creates an environment for innovation to scale, while fulfilling our mission to transform how the world builds software.

You
• Responsible to challenge the status quo in applying security in the cloud ecosystem using unique features provided by the platform.
• Have expertise in changing the software development lifecycle and want... to be part of the next wave of cloud-native applications.
• Have extensive knowledge of the software development landscape to help the sales and field engineering teams to propose the most optimal solutions for our customers.
• Have the desire and ability to travel within your assigned territory.
• Above all, have a customer-focused mindset and are a hands-on technical expert to support the sales activities in your region.
• Has a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive customer interest in Pivotal technologies

Us

There is a paradigm shift towards cloud-native technologies and methodologies calling for new capabilities. As part of Dell Technologies, this initiative focuses on uplifting the Cloud Native Ecosystem in Singapore and enabling our enterprise customers in Singapore and the regional economies.

Your Day
• This will be an Area level role. Your job will be to provide thought leadership in the area of cybersecurity to the Pivotal Field Team(s) & customers.
• Present Pivotal vision, strategy & product roadmaps to executives & technical management, especially as it related to Cybersecurity
• Provide expert technical support for opportunities involving Pivotal Cloud Foundry
• Maintain deep technical & business knowledge of technology security trends
• Maintain working knowledge of competitor products & how to technically sell against them
• Work collaboratively with Product Management, Technical Marketing & Engineering during the development, launch & continuing refinement of Pivotal products.
• Keep up to date with the latest security and technology developments

Required Skills / Experiences
• Deep knowledge of the IT security solutions landscape, information security principles and practices, and industry trends in security.
• Experience in Security Design and Architecture
• Familiarity with vulnerability and penetration testing and analysis
• Familiarity with industry regulations and security compliance standards such as PCI, HIPPA, etc.
• Liaise with stakeholders in relation to cybersecurity issues and provide future recommendations
• Excellent communication skills, both written and oral are required
• Willing to travel and work on-site with customers

Desired Skills / Experiences
• 5+ years of full-time experience in dedicated, technical information security roles.
• Understanding of PaaS offerings such as Cloud Foundry, Azure Service Fabric
• A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, related field or equivalent experience
• Having a technical certification in Security is a plus. This would include but not be limited to:
• CISSP: Certified Information Systems Security Professional
• CISM: Certified Information Security Manager
• CompTIA Security+
• CEH: Certified Ethical Hacker
• GSEC: SANS GIAC Security Essentials

Pivotal is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that will consider all qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law

title: Testing Engineer
description:
Position Summary:

As a member of our organization, you are responsible for CPU/IC testing and go/no-go decisions on CPU/IC's that go through the test center. Completes testing process and ensure that proper actions are being taken to screen for part quality/counterfeit and conformity. Exhibits proper use and maintenance use of all test tools and equipments

What we can do for you!
• Provide training to give you the knowledge to thrive in a fast-paced environment
• Offer support through a collaborative, and open environment with proven professionals with decades of QC expertise
• Enable growth through direct and focused mentorship

What can you do for us!
• Responsible for testing of CPU/IC product based on customer requirements or results of incoming inspection.
• Conducts tests on inbound CPU/IC according to the process doc and customer requirements. Reports results to Quality, Warehouse, and Commodity Managers as well as recording in RMS.
• Proper disposition of CPU/IC once testing... is completed to ensure that CPU/IC that pass go into good locations and those that fail are quarantined.
• Maintain and update proper software revisions and bios updates for all CPU/IC tests.
• Ensure proper completion of all test processes.
• Provide maintenance on boards and equipment as needed to maintain proper operation of the boards.
• Proper handling and ESD protection of all CPU's
• Maintaining board database as new platforms are brought into operation.
• Review metrics related to test results.
• Provide monthly updates on activities and improvements made on processes.
• Work with the team to further strengthen and improve test processes with a goal of 0 defects
• Suggest improvements in workflow and equipment to make testing more efficient and effective.

Who we're looking for!
• At least 3 years of work experience in the Semicon/Electronics or related industry
• Good knowledge of quality systems and QA principles, practices and standards
• A high-energy, smart, and persistent individual, driven to succeed and revolutionize an industry
• Proficient with standard business tools (email, voicemail, MS Office 365, etc.)
• Ability to juggle multiple tasks and inputs in a fast-moving environment

Established in 2001, Fusion Worldwide is a premier, global open market distributor of electronic components with an established reputation of excellence in sourcing, quality, and outstanding customer support. Solving supply chain disruptions is where we are truly able to provide key service to all our customers, and we are looking for motivated individuals like you to join this rapidly growing industry! With our company headquarters located in the scenic Boston Seaport area, we also have key locations in Amsterdam, Singapore, Munich, Guadalajara, Seoul, and San Francisco. title: Software Engineer (Cryptography)
description:
Location: Singapore, SingaporeIn fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.Thales in Singapore has been present since 1973, providing state-of-the-art solutions for customers in the aerospace, defence, security and transportation markets. Today, Thales in Singapore employs over 600 people and is home to all regional avionics services, a ground transportation integration centre, and regional innovation hub.

The Cryptography team in Singapore develops embedded cryptographic libraries for the Mobile Connectivity Solutions business unit. These libraries are integrated in Thales’ products such as removable SIMs and eSIMs. As a Software Engineer, you will be working in a stimulating environment doing software development... and evaluation. This is an ideal role for engineers who want to focus on writing small but complex functions on an embedded target.

A week in the life of an Embedded Software Engineer:

You will develop and validate software libraries implementing cryptographic functions You will incorporate security countermeasures suited for the end product’s requirements You will occasionally perform attacks on smartcards’ cryptographic module You will assist in the certification of smartcard products You monitor innovation in embedded cryptography. This includes new attack techniques or implementations.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience:

You must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering. It would be preferred if you have a Master’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, basic understanding of modern cryptographic algorithms and secure coding, knowledge of possible attacks, software countermeasures. Proficiency in low level programming languages such as C or Assembly. Strong understanding of architecture and programming model of microcontrollers. Willingness to learn Mathematical concepts related to cryptography. It would be preferred if you have used embedded development tools like emulators or development kits. We would like someone to join our team who is a strong verbal and written communicator, logical and creative problem-solver, open-minded and a quick learner. We are looking for someone with at least 2 years of experience in a software engineering position or a related role. At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now

title: Solutions Engineer - Mulesoft
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

MuleSoft is looking for a motivated Solutions Engineer to join our extremely talented and collaborative Pre-Sales team, who are instrumental to MuleSoft’s growth in the region. As a Solution Engineer, you will act as a trusted advisor to MuleSoft’s prospective customers by proving how MuleSoft’s Anypoint Platform can bring their digital investments together into an application network, allowing for faster change and innovation. You will partner closely with Account Executives throughout the end-to-end sales cycle to qualify sales opportunities with regards to customer technical requirements, decision-making process and funding. Through strong, developed relationships with the client’s IT staff and C-Level executives, you will leverage their deep technical expertise to align the client’s technical requirements to business outcomes.

What... you’ll achieve:

3 months:
• *

Become certified in MuleSoft’s Developer trainings
• Complete MuleSoft’s Kickstart sales training
• Begin to build your architecture reframe and white-boarding skills through shadowing and customer-scenario role playing
• Create a Self Service Asset on a MuleSoft technical topic of interest

12 months:
• *

Become certified in all Product, Architecture, and Sales Messaging trainings
• Successfully deliver your Self Service asset by end of second quarter
• Deliver product presentations and demonstrations that are tailored to the client’s technical requirements and audience
• Develop Proofs of Concept (PoCs) as part of an account team to demonstrate the art of the possible
• Put all the pieces together to “perfect your craft” by closing deals
• Partner with Accounts Executives on account planning and strategy and support marketing with evangelism activities (writing blogs, participating in demo-based webinars, speaking at industry events, etc.)

What you’ll need to be successful:
• *

Pre-Sales enterprise software experience, skillset to establish trust with clients, and ability to influence key decision makers in the sales cycle
• Hands on experience with middleware, integration architecture patterns, web services technologies, enterprise messaging patterns, APIs, SOA, ESB, BPM etc.
• Hands on Java development experience and ability to code and debug against Java APIs is preferred
• Experience with cloud technologies - iPaaS, SaaS applications, cloud infrastructure, etc. - is preferred
• Experience building and delivering Proofs of Concept (PoCs) and responding to functional & technical elements of RFIs/RFPs
• Ability to lead architectural discussions
• A passion for technology and translating that passion into business impact for customers
• Excellent verbal communication, written communication, and presentation skills
• Ability to travel as needed and to work flexible hours throughout the sales territory

About MuleSoft, a Salesforce company

Our mission is to help organizations change and innovate faster by making it easy to connect the world’s applications, data, and devices. Companies like Spotify, McDonald’s, and Unilever rely on MuleSoft to stay agile, deliver faster, and make the most of their IT investment with API-led connectivity. Hiring exceptional people who want to build a great company together is our number one priority, and we’re committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace where everyone is supported and inspired to do their best work. We work tirelessly to build this culture, and we’re proud to have been named the #1 Top Workplace in the Bay Area and a best place to work 6 years in a row.

title: Senior Game Programmer
description:
Gamelogic started out with a small group of gaming enthusiasts and has
since expanded into a full-fledged game development studio. As gaming
enthusiasts, we are adamant about one thing: which is to have fun. We are
experts in having a good time and we hope to offer fellow gamers a chance
to unleash their inner child through our awesome games.

Our goal is to create innovative casual games that will penetrate the
global market. Our team is made up of experienced game designers,
programmers and artists and we are constantly looking to nurture the next
generation of game developers.

When it comes to gaming for us at Gamelogic; the skys the limit.

------------------------

Title: Senior Game Programmer

Responsibilities:

Brainstorming game concepts, design elements, and specifications with
the game design team.

Leading a team of programmers and set work schedules and deadlines.

Assist project leaders with statistical testing, and suggest new
methods based on output.

Selecting... suitable game frameworks and translating concepts into clean
and efficient code.

Designing and testing gameplay features and prototypes.

Generating game scripts and storyboards, as well as animating game
characters and objects.

Contributing to user interface development, as well as the integration
of graphic design and audio features.

Performing tests and implementing validation procedures.

Documenting the full lifecycle of game development.

Maintaining code, resolving issues, and performing bug fixes.

Integrating the latest game industry trends into game designs.

Working closely with a lead game developer to create task/project
deliverables.

Interface with Quality Assurance, Game Producers, Game Designers and
Artists.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or
similar.

At least 5 years' experience as a game programmer.

Proficiency in Unity3D.

Able to work in Windows, Linux and Mac environment.

In-depth knowledge of full lifecycle game programming and related
technologies.

Highly proficient in programming languages, such as C++, C# and Java.

Superb analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

Great organizational and time management skills.

Able to troubleshoot and solve complex technical issues.

Highly analytical with excellent written and verbal communication
skills.

Excellent time management skills with the ability to work under
pressure to meet tight deadlines.

Contribute to innovation in game design.

Bonus:

Coursework or certification in game design and development preferred.

Experience in mobile games development

title: Software Engineer (Embedded Operating System)
description:
Job Description :
Job Description & Requirements

Job Scopes:- Requirements gathering; Design, development and maintenance of the software; Preparation and submission of deliverables throughout the software development lifecycles such as Business Rules, Software Requirement Specifications, Software Architecture Document, Design Specification, Interface Specifications, Source Codes, Testing Specification, Operation and Maintenance Manual, Training Manual and others documents as required in the standard adopted by the Authority; Assist the Authority with day-to-day application support issues; and Liaise with users on the requirement, design and testing issues. Job Requirements:- Degree in Electrical / Electronics / Computer Engineering or a relevant discipline; At least 5 years' experience in C++, Java programming language in Windows, RTOS systems and multi-tasking OS environment; At least 2 years' experience working in embedded systems, NFC, RFID or smart card technology; Experience in... NFC standards, NFC application development and a broad view of software testing methods; Experience and skilled in embedded firmware development and debugging; Familiar with I2S, SPI, serial communication, interrupt handling and hardware trouble shooting; Knowledge on software security and cryptography; Knowledge on Visa, MasterCard and EMV certification; Knowledge of SDLC with RUP or Agile methodology; Experience in developing test solutions, profiling and visualization of automated test results

title: Senior / Software Engineer (Oracle)
description:
EPAM is committed to providing our global team of more than 41,150 EPAMers with inspiring careers from day one. EPAMers think creatively and lead with passion and honesty. Our people are the source of our success. We value collaboration, work in partnership with our customers, and strive for the highest standards of excellence. In today’s market conditions, we’re supporting operations for hundreds of clients around the world remotely. No matter where you are located, you’ll join a dedicated, diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

Description

We are looking for an experienced Senior / Software Engineer(Oracle) in Singapore to make the team stronger.

Responsibilities
• Ensure all the technical requirements are captured in the requirement specification document
• Review the onboarding requirement specification and run-through overview sessions for our stakeholders
• Analysis the technical documentations to identify gaps and discrepancies related to feed... configurations
• Resolution of user queries and business engagement activities up to design sign off in a timely manner
• Follow the standard processes to track the onboarding projects activity status throughout the project lifecycle
• Prepare the test plan and scenarios for assigned onboarding tasks and complete the walkthrough session for our stakeholders
• Perform integration testing, conduct root cause analysis of test defects, implement fixes and prepare UAT deployments (e.g. configuration tags)
• Carry out detailed analysis of feed processing failures during testing and ensure that all the breaks or issues are identified and resolved in due time
• Make sure the risks and issues in processes are identified, reported and escalated in-time
• Support your project manager with latest status information pertaining to your feed onboarding tasks
• Collaborate and co-ordinate with our internal development teams to identify and resolve the feed archiving related issues
• Preparation of handover document for production support team and participate in post-production verification tasks

Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science / Engineering / Mathematics majors preferred
• At least 6 years of analyst and development experience in wealth management or financial service industry
• Strong knowledge and working experience in UNIX, Oracle and SQL/PL SQL technologies
• Good knowledge on MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
• Good communication skills in English to be able to interact with our colleagues and stakeholders around the world
• Experience in software development life cycle change implementation process with banking industry
• Highly driven and self-motivated individual with a can-do attitude
• Team player, interacts well and creates synergy in team environment and with our stakeholders
• A proactive and change focused mind-set with problem solving ability to deal with challenging situations

Nice to have
• Knowledge or Experience in Records management policies and procedures will be an added advantage
• Experience in tools like Scheduling (AutoSys), Ticketing tool (GSNOW), JIRA (Tracking tool), GitLab, Confluence and SharePoint are a plus
• Knowledge in IBM CMOD 9.5 and Open text other records management software solutions are an asset

We offer
• Friendly team and enjoyable working environment
• Work-life balance and flexible schedule
• Online training library, mentoring, career development and potential partial grant of certification
• Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
• Referral bonuses
• Compensation for sick leave and paid time off
• Opportunities for self-realization

title: Software Developer (Digital Solutions Department) [NIE]
description:
The National Institute of Education (NIE) invites applications for a Software Developer position in the Digital Solutions Department (DSD). We are looking for a technically talented individual to add to our mobile, application, and integration team. The candidate should be a dynamic IT professional that has good expertise in web technology and API integration.

Responsibilities:
• Design, develop, deploy, and support web applications in ASP.NET C#.
• Analyse and test programs before launch.
• Ensure software security by developing programs efficiently.
• Troubleshoot coding problems quickly and efficiently to ensure a productive workplace.
• Manage queries and provide advice to users.
• Communicate with different team members to accomplish the task.
• The desire to work in a fast-paced environment.
• Report to team lead and align to team objectives and technology guidelines.

Requirements:
• A Diploma in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems... Info-communications, or equivalent.
• Keen interest in innovating IT solutions with leading-edge technologies and development methodologies.
• Good team player, able to work with tight deadlines and fluid requirements.
• Quick learner who is passionate about the latest trends and technologies.
• Working experience in C#, ASP.NET, JAVA, JQuery, and API technology will be a bonus.

Fresh Diploma graduates are welcome to apply.

Closing Date
The closing date of the advertisement is 28 April 2021. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Other Information
NIE staff can take chartered buses at their own expense from or near their homes to NIE campus. This is subject to the availability of seats.

Hiring Institution: NIE

title: Software Test Lead
description:
• a) Create test plans, procedures and other required documentations related to testing.
• b) Work closely with Test Manager to meet all test milestones and deliverables and

ensure relevant stakeholders are well informed when there are delays due to

external factors.
• c) Preparation of test environment and execution (including re-tests).
• d) Conduct peer review to finalize documents for client submission.
• e) Carry-out various test executions of test suites/test cases with minimal supervision.
• f) Perform testing and provide support to different test phases such as System,

Integration and User Acceptance Test with internal and external stakeholders.
• g) Provide support to stakeholders for the test requirements, test results

analysis/clarifications, etc.
• h) Preparation of detailed and timely test reports to stakeholders with the effective use

of available tools such as JIRA, HP QC, iALM etc.
• i) Troubleshoot and provide in-depth analysis on the root cause for issues found... to

reporting officer and stakeholders.
• j) Learn the technical technology of the devices, cards and backend applications for

analysis.
• k) Produce add-on solution to improve testing processes and procedure to conduct

tests efficiently and productively.

Requirements
• a) Degree in Information Technology/Computer Science/Computer Engineering or equivalent.
• b) Minimum 7-year experience in software testing with hands-on manual and automation testing experience; minimum 3-year experience in leading a team.
• c) Good written and verbal communication skills in English;
• d) Able to work well both independently as well as in a team;
• e) Experience in full system development lifecycle from requirement, development, to

testing and deployment;
• f) Experience in performing root cause analysis and addressing test gaps;
• g) Experience in micro-payment or Automatic Fare Collection systems using Smart

Cards;
• h) Good capability in designing/developing effective test cases based on requirements,

and creating traceability between requirements and test procedures;
• i) Experience in diverse test execution phases (Agile testing, System Testing, System

Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing) which include preparation of the test environment, test execution, recording of test results, conducting of test reviews with both internal and external stakeholders, logging defects and following up on defects to closure will be advantageous;
• j) Relevant experience and competence with the tools used for test management, configuration management, test automation and defect tracking;
• k) Familiarity with database scripting and performance tuning will be advantageous; and
• l) Certification in software testing will be advantageous.

Benefits
13th month salary

variable bonus

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
1. RESPONSIBILITIES

· Determine business, functional and technical requirements; and participate in application design, configuration, testing and deployment.

· Perform configuration and customization of the Salesforce.com platform.

· Participate in efforts to develop and execute testing, training and documentation.

· Produce tangible deliverables such as requirement specifications, design deliverables, status reports, project plans for project and change initiatives.

· Utilize best practices to perform operational support, enhancements, and bug fixes as needed to the Salesforce.com platform.

· Follow all standard operating procedures and maintain updated ticketing for events, incidents, requests, changes, problem, etc.

· Proactively engage on continuous improvement efforts for application design, support and practice development efforts.

· Provide technical assistance and end-user troubleshooting for bug fixes, enhancements, and how-to assistance.

· Act as a point of... escalation for Service Desk and NOC ticketing for advanced issue resolution.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Academic Education & Experience

· Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent.

· At least 3 years of working experience as a Salesforce Developer.

· Experience in vendor, service, stakeholders and people management.

· Experience in agile software development and support mid to large scale Salesforce projects.

· Direct working experience on Salesforce platforms on CRM and Digital Marketing projects.

· Knowledge and experience with complex business systems integration as well as object-oriented design patterns and development.

· Experience with Agile development methodologies such as XP/SCRUM.

Skills and knowledge

· Expertise in core web technolocies including HTML5, Javascript and jQuery.

· Software engineering skills with Force.com platform (Apex, VisualForce, SOQL, Unit Testing)

· Software engineering skills with Java SE & EE (Java, JSF, SQL) preferred.

· Knowledge of relational databases, data modelling, and ETL tools.

· Have a good problem-solving skill that is able analyze issues from multiple perspectives and derive pragmatic and comprehensive solutions to problems in sometimes an ambiguous environment.

· Team player who can communicate effectively, to bring forth the ideas, plans and strategies to other stakeholders in order forge common goals and concretize deliverables.

· Able to work highly independently and good project management skills.

· Desire to work within a fast-paced, collaborative, and team-based support environment.

​
